messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] not hug buttons
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sure, but by then the damage is done.  I think that s the third spammer in as many months, and we re trying to keep a peaceful quiet nappish little group
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 6, 2005, at 10:35 PM, Ren Allen wrote:

> Did you know you can delete a specific message, then put just that
> member on moderation?
> I did that to this exact poster over at Live and Learn...she's
> apparently hitting up unschooling lists this week.
> That way, you don't have to filter through every new member. Just a
> thought.

-------------------

Sure, but by then the damage is done. I think that's the third
spammer in as many months, and we're trying to keep a peaceful quiet
nappish little group here. <g>

(I don't mind it not being quiet, and even "peaceful" isn't required,
but it shouldn't be irritating.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] not hug buttons
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m pretty sure she had a totally different id w/ the L&L email, even though the msg was exactly the same.  I think they (the SPAMers) cycle different ids,
messages.messageBody:
>Did you know you can delete a specific message, then put just that
>member on moderation?
>I did that to this exact poster over at Live and Learn...she's
>apparently hitting up unschooling lists this week.

I'm pretty sure she had a totally different id w/ the L&L email, even
though the msg was exactly the same. I think they (the SPAMers) cycle
different ids, and rarely use the same one more than once.


Barbara

Mahalo - May you be in Divine Breath

messages.subject: not hug buttons
messages.msgSnippet: I ll go and put the spam filter back on. Bummer. It means new members will have to be individually removed from moderation, but it s better than subjecting
messages.messageBody:
"I'll go and put the spam filter back on. Bummer. It means new
members will have to be individually removed from moderation, but
it's better than subjecting the list to all manner of stuff."

Did you know you can delete a specific message, then put just that
member on moderation?
I did that to this exact poster over at Live and Learn...she's
apparently hitting up unschooling lists this week.
That way, you don't have to filter through every new member. Just a
thought.

Ren
